Description:
Anybody's guess! :D

Granted by the DM for braving the storm!

Upon taking the Appraise skill, an artificer can select ONE expertise to be well-versed in (non-exhaustive examples in parentheses): Gems (Bangles, Broaches, Rings). The Artificer also gains the ability to write Schematics to replicate the effects of spells– embedding in Artificer Objects of your Appraisal expertise.  The Artificer may read scrolls, magical runes, and other materials as though they had the Read/Write Arcana spell, but only to understand them as a reference for creating items (see The Object’s Schematics below), not to cast the spells.  When scrolls are read only as a reference, they are neither activated nor expended. When using them to create a Schematic, the scroll or other reference material is expended due to experimentation.  The Schematic persists indefinitely for future projects, but must be at-hand to create an Artificer Object (they can be stolen through Pickpocket or Loot and are prioritized over coin).
Limitations: In terms of roleplay, your keen eye for objects of this category allows you to intuit its relative worth and even altered properties, subject to Organizer oversight.  Make it fun and specific to your character!  You may take this skill a number of times equal to your Artificer Tier, each time selecting a new Expertise.  An Artificer can only understand reference materials in Tier up to their Artificer Professional Expertise level. An Artificer may read as many reference materials as they like, but may only draft one Schematic per event.  These Schematics are mundane and may not be used to cast spells like scrolls.  Once drafted, a Schematic does not scale—even if an Artificer that authored it improves, the Schematic stays the same level.
Phys Rep: To Appraise - a magnifying glass, examiner’s loupe, or craftsperson-specific object.  For Schematics - an artistic architectural document that shows the fashioning of an object or demonstration of an ability.

Description: [Wondrous Items] You may attach a mechanism to an object that alters its properties in one way of your choice with no gem cost: the object (1) sheds light, as though through a light spell, (2) shows a static visual effect (or small picture), (3) makes a continuous non-damaging audio effect or a nonverbal sound, or (4) plays a recorded message when touched, up to 6 seconds long.
Phys Rep: an actual light emitting material, a picture, a small speaker, or a message strip as appropriate adhered to or within another object.  Make it!

Description: [Runes] You may disguise the meaning of your Artificer Schematics, so other fellow Artificers cannot read it to learn its secrets.  Upon creation of a Schematic, you may opt to encrypt it.  The Professional expertise required to bypass your encryption for this Schematic is your Artificer Professional Expertise Tier when the Schematic was created.
Special: Characters with Appraise [Runes] may, once per event, use a Fusion Point to increase the tier to bypass encryption (see below) by 1.  This increase may be countered by knowledge of how the runes work (the creator innately ignores it) or extracting the information from the creator.
Phys Rep: A Schematic (see The Object’s Schematics below) that hides the description, tier, and other information behind a card or other device that is labeled with the Artificer Tier necessary to decrypt.

Description: The best Artificers learn that they can get further by working together. When faced with a Schematic that is beyond their capabilities (Tier), they can utilize Cooperative Action to encrypt or decrypt Schematics and gain an advantage. The Artificer that takes the action receives +1 to their effective Professional experience Tier for each Artificer with Cooperative Action working together. In order for the Cooperative Action to be successful, the total tier must be greater than the encryption to succeed. It takes double the amount of time to complete a Cooperative Action as it would to complete the action normally.
Limitations: Keep in mind that if you encrypt a Schematic at a Tier higher than you are capable of that you will be unable to utilize it as a reference material without the help of others!
Phys Rep: All Artificers must be within touch distance of the Schematic and actively engaged in the roleplay.

Description: [Weaponry, Alchemy] Through careful art, science, and ritual, you are able to silver-plate to your weapon’s blade like Sir Artorias the Moonslayer.  Until the end of the day, your blade is silvered, allowing your attacks with this weapon to be harrowing against lycanthropes, wraiths, vampires, and other cursed entities.
Augment: Expending a Small gem and a Fusion Point, ground in during the alchemical process, instead renders the weapon silvered for an entire event.  Expending a Large gem and a Fusion Point during its creation renders the silver plating permanent on the weapon.
Phys Rep: A bladed weapon.  A number of silver pieces that, laid flat against the blade portion to cover, multiplied by three, is consumed in the act of silvering it (returned to Organizers).  The bigger the blade, the more surface area to cover in coin.  The silver coin, once applied, is consumed.  Once complete, applying a black ribbon with three silver stripes to the weapon indicates that it is silvered.

Description: [Runes]. You are able to bypass other Artificers’ Schematic Encryption.  Spend 15 minutes per Tier of the encryption to break the code, being able to use this as a reference material for use to create your own Schematic.
Special: Characters with Appraise [Runes] may, once per event, use a Fusion Point to increase their ability to bypass encryption by 1.
Limitations: You must be In-Play for the time to count.  If used as a reference material for replicating a Schematic for yourself, you mark up the formerly encrypted Schematic so much that it ceases to be useful and is effectively consumed.  Reference materials of decrypted Schematics cannot be enhanced by your own Schematic encryption at this stage.  It was difficult enough to decrypt.  You may only bypass an encryption once per event.

Description: [Wondrous Items, Clothing]. You create a curious compass or pathfinding accessory that makes it easy to traverse the Wilderness for this event.  One adventuring party of your choice who wields the wayfinder can treat Forest and Blasted Lands hexes as 1 Movement Point, rather than 2.
Augment: You may consume a Small gem and a Fusion Point to increase your adventuring party’s maximum movement points by 2.
Special: If you have Appraise [Wondrous Items] or Appraise [Clothing] and augment the wayfinder, reduce all Movement point costs by 1, including Mountains (minimum: 1 movement point per hex).
Limitations: This item counts toward the limit of equipped Artificer Objects a character may attune to at once. Multiple compasses in an adventuring party do not stack.  This Wayfinder requires an Artificer Object, but no schematic (unless you want to).
Phys Rep: A compass, pocket-watch, or ornate clothing accessory.  An Object Schematic to match.

Description: [Alchemy, Armor, Clothing]. You tinker with your headgear, experimenting with protective oils, salves, and bulwarks that bolster your safety– at least at first blush.  Once per event, you may spend two minutes applying a concoction to headgear.  This headgear confers a one-time additional floating hit. This bonus disappears once struck; it cannot be regenerated until next event.
Special: You may take this skill up to twice, once for each kind of headgear (Armor or Clothing).
Limitations: This weapon counts toward the limit of equipped Artificer Objects a character may attune to at once.
Phys Rep: Relevant headgear, such as a helm or hat.

Description: [Weaponry].  You may alter a weapon’s properties with trace energy so that it feels easy to wield.  For one encounter, a wielder of this weapon can ignore their base class weapon restrictions.
Augment: You may use a Small gem and a Fusion Point to extend this duration to four hours.
Limitations: This weapon counts toward the limit of equipped Artificer Objects a character may attune to at once.  This does not make your current one-handed weapon deal damage as though it is two-handed.  You simply can utilize a two-handed one, for example, and it doesn’t penalize you (i.e., you physically use a greatsword, not pretend like a short-sword is a greatsword).  Skills with specific limitations (e.g., Rogue’s Backstab) still require specific weapons to be utilized.
Phys Rep: A weapon.  No schematic is necessary (unless you want to add to your list of schematics).

Description: [Alchemy, Weaponry]. Through curious alchemical tinkering, you’ve bottled congealed fire.  Expend one Fusion Point.  You gain one vial of alchemist fire.  You can hurl it or use it to make your weapon wreath itself in flame.   Hurling alchemist fire deals 1 Fire Damage upon impact, which bypasses shields (but not armor).
Special: Having Appraise [Weapon] enables an additional option: if applied to a weapon, your melee weapon or consumable artillery now deals Fire damage for one encounter, causing grievous wounds to creatures like Trolls and Scarecrows.  It also sheds light as though it is a torch.
Limitations: Only a character with the Alchemist’s Fire Skill may safely use Alchemist’s Fire (projectile or weapon) without instantly going up in flames themselves.
Phys Rep: Thrown alchemist fire should mirror a LARP-safe fireball or nerf-football.  Applying alchemist fire to a weapon should be represented by a red ribbon. Attacking should be telegraphed by stating “Alchemist Fire!” then stating the damage (“1”), “Fire damage,” and “through Shields” if thrown.

Description: [Runes, Wondrous Items].  Experimenting with binding runes, you stitch a favored elemental energy into a worn quiver, sack, or bolt bag. Select a single element when you take this Skill: fire, ice, or lightning.  Once per event, for one encounter, you may change the damage type of all projectiles within the container to that element.  Your damage is the same, but with this damage type overwriting any other damage type (e.g., poison, magic, holy) by stating, “Power of the [Object]: [Element].”
Augment:
Expend a Medium Gem, a Fusion Point, and consult the Schematic that matches your chosen element (Fireball, Lightning Bolt, or Ice Storm) to empower your Quiver.  Your projectiles gain additional effects matching your Quiver’s element.
Elemental Quiver (Fire) projectiles bypass armor and shields but always deal 1 hit worth of fire damage.
Elemental Quiver (Lightning) arrows destroy shields and metal armor (“ARMOR BROKEN”), but no damage passes through.  Unarmored or non-metal armor is normal damage but lightning typed.
Elemental Quiver (Ice) destroys shields (“SHIELD BROKEN”).  All projectiles deal 0 damage. If the projectile hits a non-shield, the target is under the effects of the Healer’s Hold Person spell for 15 seconds, frozen on the spot, but gaining the Mage spell Protection from Fire (“FREEZE FOR 15, PROTECTION FROM FIRE”).  The freeze can end early under two conditions: first, If Protection from Fire’s benefit is triggered by another effect (e.g., the frozen target is hit by Alchemist Fire), it negates the fire damage, and the target is freed.  Likewise, if the target takes non-fire damage, the ice shatters (“FREED!”).
Special: This typing is for the projectile.  Damage may increase when fired from Relics or weapons empowered for damage (e.g., Relics, Blessed weapons).
Limitations: You may take this Skill only once, choosing a single element for your Quiver and Schematic.  You may not change to another element later, even if you find other Schematics.  This item counts toward the limit of equipped Artificer Objects a character may attune to at once. Projectiles may only be used by the wearer of the quiver, and they lose their element after striking a target or hitting the ground, until re-seated in the Quiver. Spells like Protection from Fire and Protection from Ice and Cold may negate projectile effects. The Rogue’s Quick Feet Skill negates all effects when active.  Lastly, if a character cannot hear your effect from across the field, it does not manifest.
Phys Rep: The Warrior or Rogue Archery skill, as well as a check-in with an experienced archer trainer. An Elemental Quiver Schematic specific to your chosen element. A worn projectile container with runes.  Each arrow or bolt transmuted must have a colored arrowhead or jewelry bag on the end of the arrow (red for fire, blue for ice, yellow for lightning). For other thrown objects (larp safe rocks, mugs, bread, etc) a colored ribbon.

Description: Focusing on their Profession, the Artificer begins to derive concentrated benefit from their creations.  While all other characters may attune to only one Artificer Object, the Artisan Artificer may don one additional Artificer Object, now benefiting from up to two effects.

[Gems].  You have a practiced eye for leveraging Gems and unlocking outsized potential.  Once per event, you may increase a Gem’s value by one level (see The Object’s Power Source below) when consuming it in the following ways: to power an Artificer skill, serve as a Power Source of an Object, or trade it to Organizers for Faction Gold Dragons.
Limitations: The appraised Gem may not exceed your Artificer Tier in value.  For example, as a Tier 3 Artificer, you may increase one Gem from Medium (Tier 2) to Large (Tier 3), but not from Large (Tier 3) to Exquisite (Tier 4).

Description: [Constructs, Wondrous Items]. You forge a helper-automaton to aid you in your Artificer tasks through a ritual with an audience.  At the end of the ritual, expend a Fusion Point.  When a homunculus is on your person and engaged in a scene, you may reduce your character’s time to attune to an Artificer Object by 1 minute (minimum 1 minute).  Once ‘built,’ the homunculus persists indefinitely and does not apply to the limit of Artificer items created in future events.
Augment: You may expend a Tiny gem and a Fusion Point to increase the reduction to 2 minutes (minimum 1 minute) for 4 hours.  You may expend a Small Gem and a Fusion to reduce it by 2 minutes (minimum 1 minute) AND grant your Homunculus the use of [Cooperative Action] for purposes of encrypting or decrypting Schematics for 4 hours.
Limitations: A plush doll, stuffed animal, figurine, 3d printed creature, or something else along those lines—tailored to look like a clockwork or created creature.  This should be plainly visible in any scene in which it is used and LARP-safe. Limitations
Phys Rep: A plush doll, stuffed animal, figurine, 3d printed creature, or something else along those lines—tailored to look like a clockwork or created creature.  This should be plainly visible in any scene in which it is used and LARP-safe. Limitations

Description: [Clothing]. A brilliant clothier can make one feel lighter on their feet.  For one encounter, you may alter a clothing set’s properties.  The wearer’s maximum AP limitation increases by 1 (to a maximum of 4) while wearing this armor.
Augment: You may consume a Large gem and a Fusion Point to extend this effect to 4 hours.
Limitations: This is limited to outfits consisting primarily of cloth, hide, and leather.  This armor counts toward the limit of equipped Artificer Objects a character may attune to at once.  This does not give you any bonus to AP.  It simply allows you to wear heavier armors without penalty (for purposes of spellcasting, sneaking, etc.) for a temporary period.
Phys Rep: A fancy outfit

Description: [Armor]. In the fires of a forge, you make the most of a piece of armor. For one encounter, you may alter an armor’s properties to make it denser and more protective.  The armor’s AP value to one hit zone increases by 1 (to a maximum of 4) while wearing this armor.
Augment: You may consume a Large gem and a Fusion Point to extend this effect to 4 hours.
Limitations: This is limited to AP1+ armors; it becomes heavier, which may limit certain Path abilities. This armor counts toward the limit of equipped Artificer Objects a character may attune to at once.
Phys Rep: Armor, gauntlets, greaves, etc.

Description: [Wondrous Items, Alchemy]. Your adept fabrication of spell-like effects allows you to create unique approaches to traps, not unlike Riastrad the Fireforged.  You may apply effects to existing traps that mimic the consequences of spells for which you have Object Schematics (see Creating an Artificer Object below).  If triggered, the trap activates this spell-like ability instead of a poison.
Limitations: A character who has Trap Use 1 or Area Trap—it need not be you, but you must create and set it together in a 3 minute RP scene.  A Riastrad’s Magic Trap is considered an Artificer Object and requires Fusion Points to bind the spell-like ability to the trap (see Eligible Skills/Spells to Artifice, below).  It is not considered ‘equipped’ like an Artificer Object is.  However, it deducts from the number of mundane Traps a character is able to create per event.  The effect can be dispelled with Break Arcana or similar alchemical abilities that would remove Artificer Effects.   If the trap is sprung or destroyed (per the T3 Rogue Skill, but NOT T4), the effect dissipates.
Phys Rep: A typical Trap that allows Rogue workflow from Detect Traps to Disarm Traps, as well as has the reference material’s effects if triggered.

Description: [Construct]. From a solution of straw, vegetation, and fear, you create an inert simulacrum of the Harvest Guard until the end of the encounter.  You may animate this construct with a Large Gem and 2 Fusion Points and bring it with you to a Land Search as an additional guardian bound to defend the lands you state.  The Harvest Guard construct is immune to Fear effects, poison, and piercing damage. In combat, it takes three hits to collapse (but takes double Fire damage).
Limitations: This circlet counts toward the limit of equipped Artificer Objects a character may attune to at once.  You may only have one construct bound to you at a time.  Note that the Harvest Guard is given a directive to defend the lands, not to defend a specific person—it will not willingly leave this hex unless you create another.  Depending on the commands given, losing control of the circlet may make the construct hostile toward the Artificer.
Phys Rep: A volunteer wearing a Harvest Guard costume (Artificer provides).  Harvest Guard constructs are eligible to use curved blades, like scythes, of any length.  The Artificer wears a lootable circlet that binds the construct to their command. The Artificer must create an Object Schematic reflective of the Harvest Guard.  This requires having met and studied the Harvest Guard (effectively Appraising them) for multiple events or relied on an expert’s Harvest Guard knowledge to create one.  A 10 minute RP scene.

Description: [Wondrous Items, Construct]. You made a discovery by spontaneously working on other Artificer Objects and have integrated them with your Homunculus’ design.  This mechanical ally can now protect you during your work.   While creating Artificer Objects, attuning Objects, and decrypting Schematics in Play Areas, you gain 2 floating hit points if attacked (not able to be stacked with other floating hit points), so long as the homunculus is near.
Augment: You may expend an Exquisite Gem and 2 Fusion Points to halve the time needed to successfully [Bypass Encryption] or attune a stolen Artificer Object (see Object Transfer – Foes, below) for four hours.  You also gain [Craft Homunculus’] augment benefits.
Special: You can increase a homunculus’ defense by casting Arcane Armor on it or by making the homunculus an Artificer Object with an Arcane Armor Schematic.
Limitations: An Artificer may only have one homunculus crafted at a time, and it may only be attuned to them. It consumes one use of Artificer alterations on the event it was empowered-- once ‘empowered,’ the homunculus persists indefinitely and does not require additional Fusion Points.  A homunculus can be destroyed taking two hits.
Phys Rep: A plush doll, stuffed animal, figurine, 3d printed creature, or something else along those lines—tailored to look like a clockwork or crafted creature.  This should be plainly visible in any scene in which it is used and LARP-safe.  A Schematic empowering your homunculus, as well as two more Schematics for Artificer Objects you have attuned to in the past.  They needn’t be activated, but you must have personally created and attuned to them.
Prerequisite: Craft Homunculus, Appraise [Construct], a 5 minute RP scene detailing the discovery and integration with other Objects in an immersive way.

Description: [Any]. You are well-practiced making specific types of Artificer Objects, so you know when you’re being swindled or things are not as they should be.  For each Artificer Object that you create of a specific Appraise type (e.g., Weaponry, Alchemy, etc.), you may add 1 to the Tier of Forgery you may detect for objects of that type– up to the limit of your Artificer Tier.  For example, as a Tier 4 Artificer, if you have created and activated two different Clothing Artificer Objects and four different Wondrous Items, you may detect Clothing Forgery currently up to Tier 2 and Wondrous Item Forgery up to Tier 4.
Special: Yes, this means it will take time to reach Tier 4 (where the Rogue’s Forgery skill is) if you haven’t built Artificer Objects of those types before– representing burgeoning expertise in Creating.  At Tier 4 or higher for a specific item type, you also gain the ability to detect magic, poison, or curses in those item types, but must declare you are doing so individually and RP the relevant time to appraise it as such per those rules.
Phys Rep: Your Appraisal phys rep.

Description: [Construct]. Your engineering talents have dipped toward war and siege engines, creating an inert weapon of war.  By expending an Exquisite Gem and 2 Fusion Points-- you may upgrade a battering ram (Warrior’s Sapper’s Toolkit) to become an alchemical cannon which allows the character attuned to hurl large artillery from or within reach of it.  The sheer size and scale of the cannon’s ammunition bypasses shields and instantly crushes characters.  Two cannon shots should destroy a gate structure or level a wall.  A cannon has 12 hit points and takes double damage from bludgeoning weapons and magic.  At the end of the encounter, the cannon again becomes an inert battering ram.
Limitations: This cannon counts toward the limit of equipped Artificer Objects a character may attune to at once.  Only one character may be attuned to this cannon and use it at a time—if they are killed, the Artificer may attune a new person with 30 seconds uninterrupted in contact with the person and the cannon.  Once set up, an alchemical cannon should not be moved for safety reasons.  It cannot be a compact and mobile gun.
Phys Rep: A large structure emulating a trebuchet, catapult, or stationary cannon.  Both the structure and ammunition should be ruled LARP-safe before being introduced into play.  How a giant hurls boulders is most appropriate (i.e., large plush ‘cannonball’ with immersive pillowcasing, etc).
Prerequisite: A character who has the Warrior’s Sapper’s Toolkit—it need not be you, but you must create and set it up together uninterrupted.  A relevant schematic detailing conversion of the battering ram to the Alchemical Cannon.

Description: You’re able to modify the trace energy of Weapon Warp into a precision tool for the job.  The wielder of the weapon can ignore their base class weapon restrictions and one specific Skill’s weapon requirements (e.g., you can use the Rogue’s Waylay with a polearm instead of a small club) until the end of the encounter.  You may determine whether this weapon is considered slashing, piercing, or bludgeoning and indicate when striking.
Augment: You may expend an Exquisite Gem and 2 Fusion Points to extend this effect to one day.

Description: [Alchemy]. Choose one specific spell at or under Tier 5 that is eligible to be created as a potion (not scroll), per the Wizard or Healer’s scrolls/potions rules.  You may create one potion of that spell per event, but flavored as an infusion or chemical.  Instead of mana, creating this potion costs two Fusion points.  Concoctions are volatile and expire at the event of an event.
Special: You may take skill this multiple times.  In doing so, you add to the list of choices of Tier 5 or lower spells that you can make a concoction of (but not add to the number of concoctions you can make.)

Description: Your very presence fosters a familiar power, substituting your essence for the other ingredients.  Choose one Artificer Skill in Milestone 1 OR a specific Tier 1 or Tier 2 Artificer Object you have created a Schematic for.  Each event, you may activate this Skill or specific Object without consuming a gem to do so– and utilizing one fewer Fusion Point than normally required.  In-game procedures for the Skill or Object (e.g., the scene, the phys rep, object activation) must still exist/happen.
Limitations: Upon taking [Artificer Affinity], you do not gain the benefits right away.  You must activate the prerequisite Skill or Object at six different events, then cap it off with a Guild-approved scene. The count of events starts at the in-game event you advise the Guild of your choice of Affinity. You may only take this skill once.  To change it, you must spend one event unlearning your Artificer Affinity first, then undergo the same procedure for the new Skill/Object.
Prerequisite: The Skill or capability to create the relevant Object, plus relevant [Appraise] skill.

Description: [Armor]. Once per event, you manipulate your shield’s density to match the might of True Dragon Nargrax Damesguard.  Until the end of the encounter, your shield cannot be broken, so long as you are standing still.  While walking, this benefit is suppressed, but reactivates when motionless.
Augment: You may consume an Exquisite Gem and two Fusion Points for the Shield to negate effects bypassing shields (e.g., Alchemist’s Fire, Fireball, Disintegrate) until the end of the encounter. While walking, this benefit is suppressed, but reactivates when motionless.
Special: This item cannot be pickpocketed.  It’s too big.
Limitations: This shield counts toward the limit of equipped Artificer Objects a character may attune to at once.  You may not move during this encounter in any way faster than a walk.
Phys Rep: A large tower shield with a silver ribbon tied to it—ideally dragonscale or with a dragon head printed on it.

Description: [Runes]. Spend 10 minutes per Tier of the encryption to break the code, being able to use this as a reference material for use to create your own Schematic.
Limitations: If used as a reference material for replicating a Schematic for yourself, you mark up the formerly encrypted Schematic so much that it ceases to be useful and is effectively consumed.  Reference materials of decrypted Schematics cannot be enhanced by your own Schematic encryption at this stage.  It was difficult enough to decrypt.  You may only bypass an encryption once per event.

Description: The Bard is able to carry an instrument of their choosing onto the field. Instruments include: flutes, acoustic guitars, mandolins, accordions, vocals, and many more.

Bardic casting- in lieu of reading from a book or scroll, a bard can perform any non-combat spell that they have already obtained via a skill path by performing for 1 minute. They do not need to hold the spellbook; they do have to incorporate any special physreps; physreps denoting the location of the effect, such as Ward ribbons, are still required. This does not apply for any combat spell. This functions for spells of tier up to their Bard Tier; at Bard T6 this functions for any spell. No usage limit.
Limitations: Requirements: performance of at least 1 minute, expend use of the affected skill, physreps required by the skill.

Description: Outside of combat, a warrior or rogue may relay a tale or sing a song in lieu of the physical/rp component of repair or lockpicking skills that they have already obtained via a skill path. Does NOT apply to pickpocket. This functions for skills of up to their Bard Tier; at Bard T6 this functions for any elegible skill. No usage limit.
Limitations: Requirements: performance of at least 1 minute, expend use of the affected skill.

Description: With a sudden clamor, loud music, or general uproarious boisterousness, the bard awakens those in the vicinity. Breaks sleep effects (and could possibly break lower tier Silence, trance/stun effects, certain mod effects?). Can be used once per day per Bard Milestone. Requirements: audible performance of at least 30s.

Outside combat, with a performance of at least 1 minute, the bard may improve the base attitude of an NPC by 1 step. The improved attitude can then be altered by PC actions as normal. If the NPC is attacked, their attitude reverts to base. Can be used once per day.
Limitations: Requirements: a performance of at least 1 minute.

Description:
At the start of combat, the player loudly declares that “I (player name) am invoking Taunting Jest against (named target)”. This invocation is followed up by making a jest, insult, or boast aimed at the named target — audible to all. This will taunt the target into prioritizing you as their target. This effect lasts until:
You are reduced to 0 hit points
You disappear from the fighting area. 
Your target is interrupted by another person having targeted them. 
Cannot be used on the same character twice in a season. Can be used once per day.
Limitations: Requirements: RP

Description: When not in combat, you can weave a song of subtle dreaming around your foes. You can target one NPC (increasing to 3 at Bard Milestone 3), and lull them into trance or sleep. This effect can be broken by an rp effort to wake the player (don't touch people without their consent please), by any kind of damage, by any ability that removes status effects, or by Alarm. It may also be broken by environmental effects, or certain NPCs may be immune to it, at mod runner or organizer discretion. If used on a character under the effect of Iron Will or Mind Shield, the use of this skill is expended with no effect. This skill may be used once per day per Bard Milestone.
Limitations: Requirements: a performance of at least 1 minute.

Description:
This favor while worn and active bestows the wearer with the ability to master the element of water and walk upon it unhindered like a great Mage from the ancient stories. The effect of this ability can be interpreted at discretion of the organizer- I.E. sure you can walk across water, but liquid surfaces like acid or lava may play out differently at organizer discretion.  
All characters affected must interact with the scene.
Limitations: Requirements: performance, favor
Phys Rep: Gold colored belt favor with a black diamond icon.

Description: Once per season, the bard may create and publicly perform an original work glorifying the actions of another character, this piece should be at least 3 minutes in length (or per organizer approval). The subject character gains a skill point. This work may also qualify for Public Entertainer.  A bard may not use this skill to benefit any single character more than once.
Limitations: Requirements: physrep and performance of at least 3 minutes
Phys Rep: Signed physrep of created piece, such as lyrics or choreography notes to be given to the recipeient

Description: Through shared song, you come to understand a creature on a deeper level than language. The Bard coaxes a creature who cannot use language into participating in a shared performance (humming along to a tune, swaying with a drumbeat, mimicking a dance) for at least 90 seconds and so gains the ability to communicate with them. Effect lasts for up to 10 minutes. May be used once per day, or twice per day at Bard T5.
Limitations: Requirements: performance of at least 90 seconds, RP.

Description: The favor while worn and active bestows upon the wearer the nimbleness of the legendary rogues in the stories of old. It confers the ability “freedom of movement”. This makes the wearer immune from abilities that would make a character frozen or paralyzed. It also allows the wearer to stand in the presence of larger foes like giants (which would otherwise force players onto their knees).
Limitations: Requirements: performance, favor
Phys Rep: Gold colored belt favor with a black arrow icon.

Description: Once per season, a bard may promote and give a performance of at least 4 minutes (or per organizer approval). Upon completion of the performance, the bard gains a skill point. This work may also qualify for Bringer of Word-Fame. You can only benefit from one skill point gain from professions per event.
Limitations: Requirements: performance of at least 4 minutes, publicly advertise performance.

Description: Your familiarity with the depth and breadth of your art gives you insight into the cultural background of Osterra. This ability allows you to potentially learn some of the context of an object or event - usually a phrase, or a few sentences at most. Can use 1/day.
Limitations: Requirements: organizer contribution, performance of 2 minutes.

Description: The favor while worn and active bestows upon the blessings of the healers of legend. The wearer when targeted by any healing spell or potion of any tier/strength level will find themselves fully restored, even from beyond death.
Limitations: Requirements: performance, favor
Phys Rep: Gold colored belt favor with a black chalice icon.

Description: Inspired by the bardic circles from our great community. A Bard knows that grand stories, inspiring dances, and brilliant performances can only be delivered to minds and hearts in a place of safety.  Outside of Combat fields, the Bard may create a specially warded area that can reasonably be considered a venue-- operating as a zone that allows entry for all and disallows combat within it.  This zone is sustained by performance within its boundary-- singing, storytelling, dancing, or other Bardic activities-- no matter who the performer is.  After 5 minutes without performance, Bardic Venue dissipates. Limitations: No character who has engaged in combat within 2 minutes may enter the Bardic Venue-- it is not to be used as a place to escape, hide,  or create an advantage in a fight.  The Bardic Venue must not be in an area denoted as a combat field. Can be used once per day.
Limitations: Requirements: two and a half minute performance to begin the bardic.
Phys Rep: Lilac ribbon (may not need to be continuous, as needed to mark boundary)

Description: The favor while worn and active bestows upon the barer the spirit of a great hero that knew how to vanquish their foe. The favor allows the wielder to strike with "True Strike", meaning the damage type the foe would be most vulnerable against. I.E. if fighting a troll, your sword would swing fire damage. If fighting another Osterran or being that has no true weaknesses though for example, this boon would have no effect and the weapon strikes as normal. The effect of this ability when it is a “super effective” damage type is traditionally considered to be interpreted as conveying “double damage” but this can be left up to discretion of the organizer/mod runner overseeing that combat and may not always apply- I.E. some rarer beings (Ferdinand being an example) exist that require special artifacts to inflict damage. This should be used for PVE exclusively and should not be used in PVP without player consent.
Limitations: Requirements: performance, favor
Phys Rep: Gold colored belt favor with a black sword icon

Description: Through your experience with either the Bardic College or the traditions of your own people, you are knowledgeable about the great tales and songs that recorded the histories of old. This ability allows you to potentially gain greater insight regarding an artifact, location, or being of some renown.
Limitations: Requirements: organizer contribution, 3 minute performance.

Description: Player can decipher magic runes and read magic. This skill is foundational and a prerequisite for all other spells. Allows for the casting of all spells at a walk.
Create a light equal to 10 feet per tier or create an area of magical Darkness equal to 10 feet per tier.
Limitations: Can only have one in play at a time
Phys Rep: 10 words in spellbook, a light producing implement or Black cloth to represent Darkness

Description: Restores use of a wounded limb, but does not heal it. Further damage to a bandaged limb will cause a character a mortal wound. This skill may also be used to “stabilize” another player, bringing them from “Dead” (Can not engage in play by any means) to “Mortalled” (can call out desperately for aid, may crawl away from combat or to original battle lines) or Mortalled to “Stable” (can move slowly, cannot use abilities or engage in combat). A player needs further healing to be Combat Ready.
Limitations: This ability is only limited by the number of bandages carried by the player.
Phys Rep: Bandage or wrap

Description: Can detect if object Blessed/Cursed, but not any details or effects. The invocation line should indicate which ailment is being searched for, as each casting can only detect one type of ailment.
Limitations: Single person or object, may be used 3x per day +1 per Healer Tier.
Phys Rep: 10 word spell in spellbook.

Description: Players learn the basic combat and safety rules and the use of hand weapons and throwables. The Healer can now utilize single handed weapons, staves, LARP safe throwables, and two handed bludgeoning weapons such as hammers, maces.
Players learn about the armor that they wear and about its effective and safe use in play. A healer’s Maximum starting Armor Point total is 2.
Players learn the art of Shield Control and may use shields in combat.
Heals 1 point of damage to a limb.
Limitations: May be used 3x per day +1 per Healer Tier, may not be used to heal mortal wounds, only able to be cast on a single character per use.
Phys Rep: 15 word spell in spellbook. Holy Symbol or focus item (like larp medkit or LARP safe doctor’s tools)

Description: Area marked cannot be exited or entered by  beings of a predetermined alignment. Combat can occur through an area surrounded by a Sanctify/Defile location spell, and beings of the predetermined alignment will take double damage from those inside the Location or if they step/move inside the location themselves.
Limitations: 1x per Tier per day, 10’ radius per tier, a healer may have one sanctified location active per tier.
Phys Rep: 25 word spell in spellbook. White ribbon around location, or object, and a written message denoting tier and caster's name

Description: The Player can detect disease or poison, identify its potential effects on characters, items, food/beverages, and other creatures of the realm.  In some cases, The Healer may also gain knowledge of the source. If a cure to the disease/poison is known in the world, the caster also gains knowledge of the cure.
Limitations: 3x per day +1 per Healer Tier. Only able to be cast on a single character or item.
Phys Rep: 25 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: Once detected with Sense Blessed/Cursed, Divine Blessed/Cursed will give the details and effects of said blessed/cursed object, person, or location. The Healer may also gain knowledge of the source as well as any known ways to cure or alleviate the effect outside of Remove Blessing/Curse.
Limitations: 3x per day +1 per Healer Tier. Only able to be cast on a single character or item.
Phys Rep: 25 Word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: Players influenced by the “fear” status effect will flee from the enemy that has caused the effect for 5 seconds or will wither to the ground, unable to fight. Console negates this effect for the targeted player after the effect has taken hold, and prevents the player from receiving the fear effect again for 1 hour.
Limitations: 3x per day +1 per Healer Tier.
Phys Rep: 25 Word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: The Healer now has access to the Tome of Blessings & Curses held by the Healer’s Guild. The Healer may choose 1 of the 3 Minor Blessings in play to place on a single item. When that item is held or possessed by another player, they are placed under the effect of the Blessings imparted. May be used 1 time per day. This skill may always be used to make a weapon Holy, allowing the weapon to deal holy damage with maximum casts of 1 per healer tier per day.
Limitations: Healer may only have one item Cursed or Blessed in play at a time. The maximum Tier of the Blessing is equal to the Healer Tier of the Caster.
Phys Rep: An item, with a colorful ribbon/band around it with the name of the blessing attached. Effect of Blessing should be written and available in a card format for the player with the item that has received the effect.

Description: Target player is fully healed from up to mortal wounds. Does not restore armor or any floating hit points/armor points, nor does it cure any ailments or physical conditions.
Limitations: May be used 3x per day +1 per Healer Tier.
Phys Rep: 30 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: Player gains the ability to lead or join a ‘Ritual’. Ritual casting is used when the tier or power of a single caster would not be enough to achieve the desired effect. Each individual participating in the ritual may cast a single spell of their choice, and add the tier of the spell they cast to the effect of the effect being created, or expanding the area or number of items affected as appropriate. Each individual can only contribute one spell to each ritual. This ability can be used to achieve effects beyond normal spellcasting, as appropriate and approved by an organizer present.

The Healer gains the ability to produce scrolls and potions. Potions may be consumed by anyone, Scrolls may only be used if the user knows Read/Write Arcana.
To Create Potions or Scrolls, please refer to the full Scroll/Potion ruleset for limitations and mechanics.
Absorbs the first 1 point of damage taken by the target, regardless of location. Once 1 point of damage is absorbed the spell fades, and the belt flag should be removed at first opportunity.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Healer Tier. Holy Armor may not be stacked with other Holy Armors, or Arcane Armor.
Phys Rep: 35 word spell in spellbook, red belt flag with one white stripe, and roleplay.

Description: Can be used to remove curse/blessing on players, objects, and locations. Before breaking an unknown curse/blessing, the magic in question must be identified through the use of “Divine Blessed/Cursed.” Remove Blessing/Curse is successful only if the tier of the caster is equal to or higher than the tier of the Curse/Blessing being dispelled. Can be cast at a higher tier level if the player has access. (RP time multiplied by level cast).
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Healer Tier, single object, person, location (10’ sq)
Phys Rep: 35 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: The Healer, using the Tome of Blessings & Curses, may now choose 1 of the 3 Minor Curses in play to place on a single item. When that item is held or possessed by another player, they are placed under the effect of the Curse imparted. Can be used 1 time per day. This skill can always be used to make an item or weapon Unholy, allowing the weapon to deal unholy damage with maximum casts of 1 per healer tier per day
Limitations: Healer may only have one item Cursed or Blessed in play at a time. The maximum Tier of the Curse is equal to the Healer Tier of the Caster.
Phys Rep: An item, with a colorful ribbon/band around it with the name of the Curse attached. Effect of Curse should be written and available in a card format for the player with the item that has received the effect.

Description: Target poison of a lesser or equal tier to the caster or any disease is neutralized and further effects are negated, but any Hit Point Damage will still need to be healed.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Healer Tier above 4.
Phys Rep: 50 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: The player may heal/restore the senses of a target player. This spell will restore sight, hearing, and touch. It will also restore the voice of a character that has been silenced.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Healer Tier above 3.
Phys Rep: 50 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: The player may stabilize or heal 1 hit point from a group of players, up to their Healer tier.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Healer Tier above 3, may not be used to heal torso/mortal wounds, Target number of persons up to caster’s highest tier. See Heal (minor) for other mechanics/effects
Phys Rep: 45 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay, each player must be pointed to or touched.

Description: The player may take the place of a wounded or killed player. This spell may also be used to assume the affliction of another player, such as blindness, or silence, or take on the illness of another player, such as poison, or disease effects. If the target player was deceased or injured, that player is healed and restored to play, including armor but not any other form of protection. The caster assumes all effects of the injury or affliction.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day, gaining an additional use every three tiers.
Phys Rep: 30 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: (Combat Magic) The player has learned to channel the negative energy of nature into an offensive power that they can throw at enemies or objects. A target hit by Warp Wood/Decay will warp all wood and decay natural materials on a humanoid-sized target rendering them unusable. Warp Wood will affect items including shields, bows, arrows, crossbows, bolts, javelins, polearms. A single Warp Wood/Decay will not affect large items such as siege weapons, gates, ships, ect., but a game organizer may determine if, and how many Warp Wood/Decay spell attacks may be able to damage some larger than humanoid sized targets.
Special: Damage: 0 points, Magic, Necrotic
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per every 2 Healer Tiers.
Phys Rep: 30 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay. 6” Brown Spell Ball

Description: The player may ask another player, or NPC, a number of yes or no questions equal to their highest Healing Tier. The target player or NPC must answer the questions to the best of their abilities and may answer with a yes, no, or brief unambiguous statement.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Healer Tier above 3. Iron Will, Mind Shield, and other abilities or spells with similar mental effects will reduce or negate Compel Truth based on Tier of user. An individual with Iron Will or Mind shield halves the number of questions Compel truth can force them to answer. Additionally if their Mage (Mind Shield) or Warrior(Iron Will) Tier is higher than the caster’s Healer Tier, Compel Truth has no effect.
Phys Rep: 50 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: (Combat Magic) The Healer summons spiritual energy that can be thrown at target player or NPC that either does 1 point of holy/unholy damage or imparts 1 of the 3 available  minor curses from the Tome of Blessings & Curses.
Limitations: All curses inflicted this way are removed if the affected player receives a Coup de Grâce style blow. May be used 1 time per day, with an additional use added for every healer tier above 3. Damage and curses are blocked by shields and armor.
Phys Rep: 30 word spell written in spellbook and roleplay. Minimum 3” black spellball, alternatively character themed coreless throwing weapons painted black may be used, such as darts, knives, and hammers. If a curse is being imparted, an invocation line including the curse name and effect should be added on to the spell, minimum an additional 5 words.

Description: The player is able to contact and communicate with the dead and is able to ask 3 questions. The soul of the deceased must answer questions truthfully and to the best of their abilities.A creature is not aware of any questions or answers given when returned to life.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Healer Tier above 3.
Phys Rep: 50 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: The Healer, using the Tome of Blessings & Curses, may now choose 1 of the 3 Major Blessings in play to place on a single item. When that item is held or possessed by another player, they are placed under the effect of the Blessing imparted.
Limitations: Healer may only have one item Cursed or Blessed in play at a time. The maximum Tier of the Blessing is equal to the Healer Tier of the Caster.
Phys Rep: An item, with a colorful ribbon/band around it with the name of the Blessing attached. Effect of Blessing should be written and available in a card format for the player with the item that has received the effect.

Description: Absorbs the first 2 points of damage taken by the target, regardless of location. Once 2 points of damage are absorbed the spell fades, and the belt flag should be removed.
Limitations: May be used 2x per day +1 per Healer Tier above 4. Holy Armor 2 may not be stacked with other Holy Armors, or Arcane Armor.
Phys Rep: 75 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay. Red belt flag with two white stripes.

Description: An amount of targets, equal to the healers tier, are healed completely from a mortally wounded state or less.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Healer Tier above
Phys Rep: 60 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay, each player must be pointed to or touched.

Description: When cast the player will receive an omen or message from an otherworldly entity about the results of a specific course of action that the players plan to take within the next 30 minutes. Other information can be provided at the organizer’s discretion
Limitations: May be used 1x per day. Requires Game Official to be present.
Phys Rep: 75 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: (Combat Magic) Player summons spiritual energy in the form of a sphere that may be thrown at the target player or NPC. If a target is hit by the Hold Person spell they are frozen in place for 15 seconds per healer tier. May not be blocked by shields.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per every 2 Healer Tiers.
Phys Rep: 50 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay. 6” White Spell Ball

Description: The Healer, using the Tome of Blessings & Curses, may now choose 1 of the 3 Major Curses in play to place on a single item. When that item is held or possessed by another player, they are placed under the effect of the Curse imparted.
Limitations: Healer may only have one item Cursed or Blessed in play at a time. The maximum Tier of the Curse is equal to the Healer Tier of the Caster.
Phys Rep: An item, with a colorful ribbon/band around it with the name of the Blessing attached. Effect of Curse should be written and available in a card format for the player with the item that has received the effect.

Description: (Combat Magic) The Healer has developed the ability to gather and focus their spiritual energy and faith onto a weapon to deliver a powerful attack. Once cast, the next attack that lands on an opponent anywhere (weapons and shields) by the imbued weapon does 1 additional damage, with additional damage added for every other Healer tier over 4. That damage counts as holy or unholy.
Limitations: May only be used once per encounter, up to a maximum of 3 times per adventure day, with an additional use added every other Healer Tier over 4. Does not stack with any other damage multipliers/buffs
Phys Rep: 75 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: The caster’s mastery over death has reached the point where a body may be reanimated from death to create a minion to serve them. The targeted creature is Reanimated as an Animated Dead. During Casting, the caster may select to animate the creature or player as either a Zombie (2 HP, can only walk) or a Skeleton (1 HP, moves freely ignores thrusts and arrows). Both attack with Necrotic damage. The most basic form of reanimation, these creatures are dependent on the orders of their master and can only follow the most basic of commands. In absence of commands from their master, they attack the nearest creature until destroyed.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per every 2 Healer/Mage Tiers. Players may decline to be animated. A player may only have one Animated Dead in play per 2 Tiers
Phys Rep: 75 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay. Skeleton Mask or Gray Headband, Zombie Mask or Black headband

Description: Once this spell is written in the player's spell book, the player may half the casting time of basic Healing spells. The word length of such spells may be reduced by 50%, rounded up.
Limitations: Only applies to Heal Minor, Heal Major, and the group versions of those spells.
Phys Rep: 200 word reference in spellbook.

Description: Target is brought back to life from death. They are fully healed and can remember their death and the events leading up to it. Does restore armor and other items
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Healer Tier above 5.
Phys Rep: 100 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: Player may gain additional mana points equal to half their healer tier (rounded up) for use with the ‘Scrolls and Potions’ skill for the creation of potions.
Special: While using preferred Physical Representations with instructions written in their spellbook to convey their use, all spells that detect ailments, cure ailments, and heal senses casting times are halved.
Phys Rep: 100 word Reference in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: Once this spell is written in the player's spell book, The Healer is able to use their shield as their spell focus and it is imbued with magical resistance. The healer may now cast without referencing their spellbook. A good effort should be made to affix representations of the healer's spell on the back of their shield, and casting time remains the same, and players must recite invocation lines. The shield is now also able to block magical attacks up to the wielder’s tier and resist magical shield breaking effects up to the healer's tier.
Phys Rep: 200 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay. The caster must memorize their spells, and/or have them written on the back of the shield, to jog their memory.

Description: (Combat Magic) The Healer summons spiritual energy that can be thrown at target player or NPC that either does 2 points of holy/unholy damage or imparts a major curse from the Tome of Blessings & Curses.
Limitations: All curses inflicted this way are removed if the affected player receives a Coup de Grâce style blow. May be used 1 time per day, with an additional use added for every healer tier above 5. Damage and curses are blocked by shields and armor.
Phys Rep: 50 word spell written in spellbook and roleplay. Minimum 3” black spellball, alternatively character themed coreless throwing weapons painted black may be used, such as darts, knives, and hammers. If a curse is being imparted, an invocation line including the curse name and effect should be added on to the spell, minimum an additional 5 words.

Description: Continued study in the necromantic arts allows the player to increase the strength of their undead minions. The caster may now create their Skeleton or Zombie as a Knight, which triples their hit point pool and allows them to speak and follow more advanced commands. The Knight may now also use Mighty Blow a single time if they wield a two handed weapon.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per every 2 Healer Tiers. Players may decline to be animated. A player may only have one Undead Knight in play per 3 Tiers of experience.
Phys Rep: 100 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay. Gray headband with two black skulls or an even meaner skeleton mask.

Description: The Healer now gains the ability to utilize Blessings/Curses that have been in The Tome of Blessings & Curses at any time, without having to adhere to the seasonal selection of the blessings and curses. Additionally, the player may now have up to two cursed/blessed items in play at a time. The healer may now also attempt to create Minor & Major Blessings and Curses by working with Organizers.
Phys Rep: 100 word reference in spell book

Description: A number of targeted creatures up to your tier may now be Reanimated as Animated Dead. If cast on a player they are Animated for 10 minutes or until slain; after they may continue to role play as the undead minion of the casting player until death if they wish, or return to play as normal, with no memory of their death or what they did while animated. During Casting, may select to animate individual creatures or players as either a Zombie or a Skeleton. The most basic form of reanimation, these creatures are dependent on the orders of their master and can only follow the most basic of commands. In absence of commands from their master, they attack the nearest creature until destroyed.
Special: Upon taking Animate Group of Dead, the limit of the number of Animated Dead under your control is increased to 1 Per Healer/Mage Tier
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per every 2 Healer/Mage Tiers. Players may decline to be animated.(See Animate Dead)
Phys Rep: 100 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay. See Animate Dead for specifics.

Description: Restore Memory gives the caster the ability to bring back lost memories from the target’s previous lives, or memories lost, or shrouded by other magics. When a Healer casts Restore Memory the target player or NPC can recall what happened in their last life, and the circumstances surrounding and deaths during that day/event. In the case of memories lost, or shrouded by other magics an Organizer may be necessary in order to determine the Tier of the other caster, and nature of the memories to be recovered.
Limitations: If the caster of the magics clouding the memories to be restored is greater than the Tier of the Healer, then they can not be restored. Can only be used 1 time per day + 1x per healer tier after 6th.
Phys Rep: 100 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: The player imbues an item with Holy/Unholy energy, Relic weapons deal +1 damage, all damage from the weapon is considered Holy/Unholy. May overcome standard weapon resistance of some creatures.
Special: Duration: Events equal to half the Healer’s Tier
Limitations: A player may only have one Relic in play at a time.
Phys Rep: 100 word spell in spellbook, ritual magic roleplay. Blue ribbon and white ribbon tied on the weapon marked "RELIC"

Description: Healers use Spontaneous Spell to imbue an item, like a holy symbol, healing icon, or other focus item with a spell for later use. The player casts Spontaneous Spell first, and then the spell that they wish to be used instantly later, excluding the invocation line. When the player wants to unleash the stored spell they first must declare “Spontaneous Spell” and then recite the invocation line of the stored spell to be cast.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Healer Tier above 6. One spell at Healer Tier 6, plus one spell per Tier. All Spontaneous Spells reset after the conclusion of an event.
Phys Rep: 140 word spell in spellbook, holy symbol, healing icon, or other spiritual focus, and role play.

Description: (Combat Magic) While chanting this spell, and for every time the chant and roleplay is repeated within touch of the target, heal 1 wound or hit of damage to the desired target. If words can heal, they can also hurt. While chanting this spell, and for every time the chant and roleplay is repeated within touch of the target deal 1 wound or hit of damage to the desired target. Spell Lasts until interrupted, or chanting stops.
Limitations: 1 use per event, with an additional use received every other tier. May only be used on players that are at maximum mortally wounded.
Phys Rep: 100 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay. The healing effect begins and The caster must create a six word chant that they will rhythmically speak or sing for the duration of the spell. For every Tier after 6th you may reduce the chant by one word.

Description: (Combat Magic) The Mage is able to draw dark energy from the rotted roots of Leylines and cast a ball of necrotic energy at their foes. If the target is a player hit by the spell they are engulfed in a blast of necrotic energy, the life force is drained out of them and they are killed regardless of armor. If the target is an NPC it takes 4 wounds of Necrotic magic damage. Destroys shields on strike.
Special: Damage: 4 points, Magic, Necrotic
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per every 2 Mage Tiers.
Phys Rep: 80 word spell in spellbook and roleplay. 6” Black Spell Ball

Description: The healer may now bless or curse an area rather than an object. The healer may use one ribbon equal to their healer tier in length (in feet) with which they can create an area of any shape. Anyone whose feet cross over the ribbon will be affected by the blessing or curse set onto the area.
Limitations: May be used 1x per day, an additional use gained every other tier.
Phys Rep: 140 words in spell book, red ribbon to outline area. If in combat, state loudly “CURSED AREA [EFFECT]” As the first person steps through (possible limit to curses with very obvious effect names, like curse of Slowness)

Description: The Healer can now imbue a single player (including themselves) with the power to rise after being mortally wounded once per event. The player, provided no “Coup de Grâce” finishing move is performed, may return to battle at a single hit point after 15 seconds of RP on the ground, wherein they call out to the healer, the healer’s patron, or another symbol to signify their return to play.
Phys Rep: 150 word spell performed on the player, with a charcoal or paint mark left on a visible area of the player denoting the symbol of the healer.

Description: A healer with this skill can now Create a Sanctuary for healing and giving aid to adventurers. Other healers, even without this skill, may assist in forming a Sanctuary. A sanctuary can encompass an area of 10 feet per healer tier that assists with creating the space. Inside the sanctuary, healer skills are not expended, and all skills are performed at twice the speed.
Phys Rep: 150 word Spell Read with other healers intending to create a sanctuary. Space must be clearly denoted with a Sanctified Location spell.

Description: When cast, the recipient will be immune to the first instance of a blessing or curse they come into contact with. Subsequent or consistent contact with the same blessing or curse will still impart the effect.
Limitations: May be used once per day, +1 for every healer tier after 7.
Phys Rep: 140 words in spell book

Description: The Mage can decipher and read magic runes. This ability is represented by a rune cipher in their spellbook. The Mage is able to cast spells while walking or standing still.
The Mage can create magical light or magical darkness.
Limitations: Can only have one in play at a time
Phys Rep: 10 words in spellbook, a light producing implement or Black cloth to represent Darkness

Description: The Mage can sense if an object has arcane properties, but not any details of powers or effects.
Limitations: Use on a single person or object
Phys Rep: 10 word spell in spellbook.

Description: The Mage learns the basic combat and safety rules and the use of hand weapons and throwables. For Mages, this includes one handed weapons, staves, LARP safe throwables, and two handed bladed weapons.

The Mage is allowed 1 floating Armor Point (AP) when they physically wear a hat, head covering, or other protective LARP styled headgear. The Mage inherently has no Armor Proficiency and cannot receive benefits to their AP total from physically wearing armor. At Tier 4, the Mage may treat this skill as the prerequisite to Cross-Train the skill Armor Training (Warrior Tier 2 skill) to increase their AP to 1 and may take the Warrior skill Armor Training at later Tiers to allow a maximum possibility of 2 AP as a main-class Mage. A Mage untrained in Armor is unable to cast spells while wearing Armor.
The Mage repairs a single, small unmagical object 12” or smaller or one hit location of armor.
Limitations: Single person or object
Phys Rep: 25 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: Once an object is defined as magical via Sense Arcana, the Mage can sense its arcane properties and any details of the object’s powers or effects.
Limitations: Single person or object
Phys Rep: 25 word spell in spellbook, and roleplay.

Description: The Mage protects themselves and others. This spell, cast on one person at a time, absorbs the first point of damage taken by the target, regardless of that hit’s location.
Limitations: Once 1 point of damage is absorbed, the spell fades and the belt flag should be removed at the first opportunity.
Phys Rep: 25 word spell in spellbook, red belt flag with one black stripe, and roleplay.

Description: The Mage may now create a protected area with a ward. Warded areas cannot be entered or exited until the ward is lifted or broken, except for those the spellcaster specifically allows in and/or out. Warded objects may not be opened or destroyed without breaking the ward first. Strength of Tier increase possible with Arcane Confluence.
Limitations: Projectiles may not be fired into or out of a warded location. A ward may not be fought through.
Phys Rep: 25 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus. Yellow ribbon around location or object, and a written message denoting tier, allowed entrants, and caster's name.

Description: The Mage gains the ability to use a staff imbued with the Mage’s energy. The staff may act as a Focus for spellcasting, and may be considered an extension of the Mage where touch is concerned for casting and game play.
Limitations: Regardless of whether this staff is wielded in one hand or two, it always does 1 point of damage. Once a staff is imbued with Magic in this way, it can not be further enchanted by standard means.
Phys Rep: LARP safe staff

Description: The best Mages learn that they can get further by working together. Arcane Confluence can be used to upcast specifically noted spells with the aid of other Mages. The Mage who casts the spell receives +1 to their effective Tier for each Mage trained in Arcane Confluence working together. Any spell that receives additional uses per tier or can be upcast to be of a higher tier is compatible with this skill. A Mage may help add to or break a ward so long as they possess this skill, even if they have not yet taken the spell being enhanced with Arcane Confluence.
Limitations: The invocation must be initiated by a Mage who already possesses the training for the spell in question. Spells cast with Arcane Confluence take double the amount of words they normally would (a reread of the spell or certain parts of the spell is appropriate).
Phys Rep: All mages must be within touch distance of the area, and engaged in role play.

Description: A Mage’s secrets must be guarded. A Mage can thread some of their magic into the sealing of a missive, letter, tome, or other written material, including Profession documents, to prevent any other than the intended recipient from opening it. A Magic Seal can only be broken by the unintended recipient via Break Arcana. Strength of Tier increase possible with Arcane Confluence
Phys Rep: 25 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus. Silver and Green ribbon wrapped around the written material. A wax stamp or drawn symbol, the name of the intended recipient, and the Tier of the casting Mage marked on the exterior of the written material.

Description:
The Mage gains the ability to produce scrolls and potions. Potions may be consumed by anyone, Scrolls may only be used if the user knows Read/Write Arcana.
To Create Potions or Scrolls, please refer to the full Scroll/Potion ruleset for limitations and mechanics.
The Player can understand any one chosen language, written or spoken. This can be cast on the Mage themselves or another Player.
Limitations: Lasts 10 minutes
Phys Rep: 35 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus

Description: The Mage is able to weave a spell to protect a player, object, or area from the effects of a chosen element (Fire, Ice, Lightning, Necrotic). This protection negates the first instance of damage or a single effect from the chosen element.
Special: Duration: 4 hours or until enchanted player is Mortally Wounded.
Limitations: The caplet or ribbon should be removed after the damage is absorbed.
Phys Rep: 35 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus. A red caplet placed on the player, object, or area under protection.

Description: A Mage may use their authority over the Leylines and their spellcasting abilities to Push another player back. The spell must include the number of steps the opposing player is pushed back.
Limitations: Cannot be used on the same player twice in one day.
Phys Rep: 10 word spell in spellbook, that includes distance player is pushed back and the name of the spell to denote the effect. Two outstretched arms in a pushing motion preferred for clarity.

Description: Once an object’s magical aspects are defined via Divine Arcana, the Mage can dispel the magic on a single object, player, enchantment, or warded location. Can be cast at a higher Tier than Tier 2. Strength of Tier increase possible with Arcane Confluence.
Limitations: The Arcana must first be examined through the use of Divine Arcana. The spell is only successful if the Mage Tier of the caster is equal to or higher than the Tier of the magic being dispelled.
Phys Rep: 35 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus

Description: The Mage conjures a shield of magical energy for themselves. The Magic Shield can be used to block Combat Magic Spells an amount of times equal to the caster of the shield’s Mage’s Tier.
Special: Duration: 4 hours
Limitations: The Mage may only have 1 Magic Shield in play at any given time. The Mage’s Magic Shield can only be wielded by its caster.
Phys Rep: 35 word spell in spellbook and a Green shield 27” or less in diameter.

Description: A Mage’s secrets must be closely guarded. The text of a magically sealed document is unreadable to those not bound to its delivery. Any who attempt to read the document must sign their true and full name on the page. Advanced Magic Seal can be broken with Break Arcana. Strength of Tier increase possible with Arcane Confluence.
Phys Rep: 35 words in spellbook, Silver and Green ribbon wrapped around the written material. A wax stamp or drawn symbol, the name of the intended recipient, and the Tier of the casting Mage marked on the exterior of the written material. A designation reading “Invisible Ink” on the interior of the page.

Description: Mages train to steel themselves against the rigors of combat or dangerous situations in order to be able to cast their spells. Steady Spellcaster allows the Mage to move with complete freedom around the battlefield while still maintaining their focus to cast a spell. The Mage only needs to cast this on themselves once.
Limitations: All other standard limitations to casting remain
Phys Rep: 50 word reference in spellbook.

Description: The Mage repairs a single, medium unmagical object 48” or smaller or all hit locations of armor for a single player.
Limitations: Single person or object
Phys Rep: 50 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus

Description: The Mage protects themselves and others. This spell, cast on one person at a time, absorbs the first 2 points of damage taken by the target, regardless of that hit’s location.
Limitations: Once 2 points of damage are absorbed, the spell fades and the belt flag should be removed at the first opportunity.
Phys Rep: 50 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus. A red belt flag marked with two black stripes.

Description: The Player can read, write, and converse in any one chosen language. This can be cast on the Mage themselves or another Player. Comprehend Language is not required to cast in advance of Speak Language.
Special: Duration: 10 minutes
Phys Rep: 50 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus

Description: As the Mage’s skill with magic grows, so does the deadliness of the magic they’ve imbued into their staff. The staff may act as an Arcane Focus for spellcasting, and may be considered an extension of the Mage where touch is concerned for casting and game play. The Mage may gain additional mana points up to half the player’s Mage tier rounded up for use with the ‘Scrolls and Potions’ skill for the creation of Scrolls only.
Special: Damage: Magic 2 when held with 2 hands, Magic 1 when held with 1 hand.
Limitations: Once a staff is imbued with Magic in this way, it can not be further enchanted by standard means.
Phys Rep: LARP safe Mage’s staff

Description: The Mage summons three bolts of magical energy that can be thrown at their enemies. Magic Missile can also be used to destroy objects such as chests, gates, walls, siege engines and more. May be blocked by shields. Normal armor rules apply.
Phys Rep: 15 words summons the first missile. 10 more words summons the second missile. 10 more words summons the third missile.  Minimum 3” black spellball, alternatively character themed coreless throwing weapons painted black may also be used, such as darts, knives, or axes.

Description: The Mage can communicate with the dead. The soul of the deceased must answer these questions truthfully and to the best of their abilities. The soul is unaware of any questions asked or answers given when returned to life. The soul is not required to answer additional questions with any subsequent uses of the spell.
Limitations: The Mage is able to ask 3 questions
Phys Rep: 50 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus

Description: The Mage can now store spells they’ve already learned into their chosen Focus for later use.
Limitations: At the start of each day, the Mage may store an amount of spells equal to half their Mage Tier rounded up. The same spell may be chosen multiple times.
Phys Rep: 5 words that include the invocation line of the chosen spell

Description: The Mage oversees a magically binding agreement between two entities. The Covenant does not break until the deal is fulfilled on both sides. The document should include the terms of the agreement and the consequences if the Covenant is broken. The Covenant cannot be broken by Break Arcana.
Special: The mage may have only one active Covenant at any given time
Limitations: Single target. A mage may only have one active Covenant at any given time. Must include a pre-established agreed upon consequence if ‘broken’.
Phys Rep: 75 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus. A written parchment signed by the Mage and any additional parties.

Description: The Player’s mind is shielded from mental interference. They will not succumb to mental magics, psionic mind control, or other psionic effects including Compel Truth
Special: Duration: 1 hour or player death
Limitations: Mind Shield does not negate Fear.
Phys Rep: 75 word spell in spellbook Arcane Focus

Description: The Mage is able to weave a spell to protect a player, object, or area from the effects of magic. This protection negates the first instance of magical damage or magical effect.
Special: Duration: 4 hours or until the enchanted player is Mortally Wounded
Limitations: The caplet or ribbon should be removed after the damage is absorbed.
Phys Rep: 75 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus. A silver caplet placed on the player, a silver ribbon placed on an object, or a silver ribbon around the area under protection.

Description: The Mage draws another spellcaster into an immediate mental contest. The other spellcaster must enter the duel with the Mage. The winner of the duel chooses a combat spell to remove from the spellbook of the loser; the removal lasts for one game day. The duelers are untouchable by others while engaged in the duel. Examples of Mental Duels may include but are not limited to Rock-Paper-Scissors, a Dance Battle, a Staring Contest.
Limitations: If the challenged player is not, in fact, a spellcaster, the spell fizzles and is spent with no effect.
Phys Rep: 75 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus

Description: The Mage summons a great electrical charge of magical energy in the form of a single Lightning Bolt. Lightning Bolts can also be used to destroy objects such as chests, gates, walls, siege engines and more. Bypasses metal armor. May be blocked by shields, but the shield is then destroyed.
Special: Damage: 2 points, Magic, Lightning
Limitations: May be used 2x per day +1 per Mage Tier above Tier 4.
Phys Rep: 40 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus. 3” minimum blue spellball or alternatively character themed coreless blue throwing weapons such as bolts, darts, knives, or axes.

Description: The Mage’s mastery of death has advanced to the point where they may reanimate a lifeless body to create a minion to serve them. The Mage may select to animate a dead creature as a Zombie (2HP, movement limited to walking) or a Skeleton (1HP, moves freely, ignores thrusts and arrows). Both attack with Necrotic Damage. Both take double damage from Holy damage. Both are dependent on orders from their master and can only follow the most basic of commands. In the absence of commands from their master, they attack the nearest creature until destroyed. When players regain life, they do not regain any memories of their actions while animated.
Special: Duration: 10 minutes or until slain. If not slain within 10 minutes, the undead player may choose to remain an undead minion to the casting Mage for only as long as they wish.
Limitations: Players may decline to be animated.
Phys Rep: 75 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus. Skeleton mask or gray headband, Zombie mask or black headband

Description: The Mage is able to immediately repair large objects and large numbers of objects all at once. A single large item or a number of small items equal to the Mage’s Tier en masse are able to be repaired. As the Mage gains Tiers, they are able to repair even larger structures. For the purposes of this spell, armor, weapons, shields and other hand held items count as small items and are repaired to their full structure or armor point value. Anything not easily lifted by a single person or that is obviously large, such as a castle gate or the hull of a ship, counts as large. Strength of Tier increase possible with Arcane Confluence.
Limitations: This spell does not restore broken magical properties.
Phys Rep: 100 word spell  in spellbook, Arcane Focus. The spell invocation must include terminology of what they would like to repair or what is in their range to repair.

Description: The Mage imbues a single weapon or item with magic.
Limitations: This spell does not stack with weapons or items that are already enchanted with Magic or Holy capabilities.
Phys Rep: 100 word spell in spellbook, Arcane Focus. Green ribbon tied to the weapon or item.

Description: The Mage gathers a sphere of magical energy in the form of a single Fireball. Fireball can also be used to destroy objects such as chests, gates, walls, siege engines and more. Bypasses both shields and non-metal armor.
Special: Damage: 4 points, Magic, Fire
Limitations: May be used 1x per day +1 per Mage Tier above Tier 5.
